Articles.Content: Scott Manly, because his form of humour intrigues me.
Scott Manley and Bob Fitch are my favorites. Because of Scott I have stumbled upon KSP while Bob's storytelling and attention to detail just amaze me
Scott Manley is my favorite. Great videos, but what really pushed it over the top is saying 'the Mun' in his accent.
And an honorable mention: Pixel stache... He made only a dozen episodes back in version .21, but it was so inspiring... Thank you for those awesome episodes.

I liked watching Scott Manley before I got the game,

Now I like edited full-mission videos featuring impressive (aesthetic, functional, etc'...) craft.

This includes G4Virus' large cargo spaceplane videos, who deleted his account... and Maccollo's KSP videos.(grand tour, RSS Moon & Duna missions)

I sometimes make this kind of videos too.

Overfloater he makes great sstos.

And Scott Manley is second best.

Then the Danny guy.
What? Nobody likes me?
The Great Manly Scott, of course.

RobbaZ the unstoppable Viking I love a good laugh and Robazz delivers in spades

2nd everybodies fav Manley followed by everybody else as these days I seem to get more time watching then playing ( Work has youtube but kids wont handover the PC without a bribe )

Scott Manley, kurtjmac, Bob Fitch and EnterElysim.

Edited September 12, 2014 by CDK

I mostly like Scott Manley a lot though, he's not ever on Kerbal Space Program Forum, his user name is illectro. I send him private messages and visitor messages and he doesn't respond ever (I also made a comment on this page).

Edited September 12, 2014 by CDK
I don't want to give the other gameplayers dislikes or anything like that though.

What? Nobody likes me?

I think your kinda funny . I watch your videos quite some time too. I like them.

Scott Manley, Bob Fitch, Tyler Raiz (He does RSS stuff), 1kbShort and EnterElsyium.

(Can't forget 5th Horseman! )

Edited September 13, 2014 by Sylandro
RadiationGamer. That's me. lol

-Xacktar is a must for your dose of crazy muffins.

-Gotta love Flobbert (Bagel Rabbit).

-Piloting skills? Awesome ships? Cupcake Landers.

-Andrew Hansen: The next Scott Manley.

-Crazy spaniard with giant robots, mod extraordinaire: m1sz

Edited September 13, 2014 by Wooks

Danny. Period.

I watched a few vids of Manley and learned to dock with his tutorial. Rest of channels that I found are BORING: half an hour and watch the entire building process? Are you kidding me?
Easily Robbaz

I watch

-Scott because some of the stuff is interesting

-HOC time to time

-xXLeGoldFishXx for the music videos

-Nassult for the Cinematics

-Myself time to time

-Kurt i love the old KSP episodes

ALL of the above i enjoy including Wooks, M1 and Xcater (Forgot how to spell it).

How come drjonez hasn't been mentioned yet?

Although he hadn't update anything in a good while, his videos teached me some great things about KSP. And his communication is very easy going; I like that a lot.

I liked Xacktar mentioned above. The kraken gun was hilarious.

And this guy makes great short tutorials that were useful in space plane building for me.

- - - Updated - - -

I liked Xacktar mentioned above. The kraken gun was hilarious.

And this guy makes great short tutorials that were useful in space plane building for me.

Xacktar by a long way.

The most under-subscribed youtuber EVER
My favorites would be Danny2462, Scott Manley and LeGoldFish.

Since recently: roninpawn all the way.

http://www.youtube.com/user/roninpawn

Hands down the funniest ksp youtuber (disclaimer: for the style of humour that i love, your mileage may differ, but imho that means your not right in the head) (disclaimer 2: the last sentence was also only my opionion)

For the rest: manley. Nuff said.
I'm usually not going for that kind of comedy-driven lets play, but Robbaz KSP-videos are wonderful. I learned about KSP through his videos.
